quest.name: Mi Casa, Toupasa
journal: Almet would have you hurry to the pyramid.
objectives: Carry the owl statuette to its proper altar.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I swear, if the Eulmorans harm so much as a hair on the heads of the Blessed...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Time is against us, friend.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Quickly, into the pyramid.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Our way has been barred...again. I am beginning to lose my patience.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: The switch should be through these doors, in the Confessional of Toupasa the Elder. But why is it not open?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Magic appears to be flowing through the walls, but it's being obstructed as it approaches the door.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Hmmm. Is it not strange that only one of these pedestals bears an owl statue?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Strange indeed. The second statue was likely hidden to keep the door sealed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We can cover more ground if we split up. Almet, take the chamber to the south. Forename, the one to the east.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I will search the chamber to the west.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Still no sign of the statue. It has to be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: I can spot trespassers from four hundred yalms away, and yet this simple statue eludes me. How embarrassing...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: I have looked everywhere, andâ”€ Wait, is that...?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: The statue! You found it!

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: It looks light enough. We need but return it to the other altar, no?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: One might assume so, but nothing about these ruins has ever been quite so simple.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I sensed a strange energy emanating from the eyes of the statues in the corridors of this place. Should this figure be moved, it would not surprise me for them to suddenly stir to life.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: A trap, then. For the unsuspecting as they attempt to return this to its rightful place.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Precisely. Caution would serve us well here.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Which is why I would ask you to deliver this statue to the main chamber.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: An abundance of magick yet courses through these walls. For my eyes, distractingly so. I believe yours, on the other hand, would more aptly perceive the traps for what they are.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: All right, then. We will meet you at the door to the Confessional of Toupasa the Elder.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deliver the owl statuette to the altar at the entrance of the Confessional of Toupasa the Elder.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will have two minutes to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be wary of attacks from enemies, which will sap your strength.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Beware the stare of those statues, Forename. I dare not think what will happen should they catch sight of you.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Would that I could bear the statuette in your stead, but it is not my place. Take care, and beware the owls.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The owl statue's eyes take on an eerie glow. As the light fades, you realize the statuette has disappeared from your hands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deliver the owl statuette to the altar at the entrance of the Confessional of Toupasa the Elder.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will have two minutes to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be wary of attacks from enemies, which will sap your strength.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though the altar remains vacant, the top appears worn, suggesting something once rested here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You successfully deliver the statuette to the altar.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: The statue is returned, but was that enough?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I believe it was. I can see aether flowing to the door now.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I pray this means an end to the tricks and traps of these ruins.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well done.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The sooner we can enter the Qitana Ravel, the better.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: You are but one step from entering the Qitana Ravel, but I must warn you: this last step is without question the most perilous.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Overcome this final trial, and the path forward will open to you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A path laden with more puzzles and traps, I'm sure. Did the emperor always take such pleasure in wasting the time of his allies?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Let us end this, Forename. While time is yet on our side.
